column1:
Odeinoichus,"2018-03-30T19:44:17.147Z","Interesting Concept for LEGO.","

Set #30338 Fire Car: LEGO Juniors is meant for younger builders emerging from Duplo and wanting to build with regular LEGO bricks. This set is a Polybag from the Juniors theme and it captures the essence of the Theme quite well.
Pros:

column2: The model is very simple and quite easy to build.
The Minifigure can fight a small fire which is included next to a LEGO tree piece.
The LEGO tree piece.
Price is quite good.

column1: Cons:

column2: Car model looks a little silly with the siren clipped onto the old LEGO toolbox piece. Not really a toolbox, but shaped like an old school one.
Not much to do with this set alone, requires other sets to have the most fun with, in my opinion.

column1: Overall opinion

This Polybag isn’t terrible from the viewpoint that as a Juniors set it really works, but for older KFOLs and even AFOLs it does come off as a bit lackluster. I feel that LEGO has done a good job capturing what they want to do with these Juniors sets here, but I also feel that the Juniors idea as a whole is a little close to the problems LEGO faced when they started limiting designs and using less parts during the dark times of the company near the beginning of the 21st century.

Still I’d definitely recommend this set to someone looking for something for a child in the age range of LEGO Juniors. Some children may prefer the more detailed builds in regular LEGO Theme sets, but Juniors isn’t entirely a bad thing. It includes some printed elements as well, so there are no stickers to worry about. Recommended.
The building experience was not very good due to it just being a car with a not very eventful tree/fire. The parts are nothing to praise over. The price is ok and the playability is meh.
